definition: to undertake to do everything by oneself/to run the whole show
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with
to take care of a matter all by oneself/to run the whole show
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
to do everything oneself (idiom); not to allow others in on the act

sentences.english: But it was also a bold attack on feudalism and arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 但它同時也是對封建制度和包辦婚姻的一記猛擊。

sentences.english: This is an example of the apparent success of arranged marriage.
sentences.chinese: 這是一例表面看來很成功的包辦婚姻。

sentences.english: Previously, companies dictated what software and hardware were used for work purposes.
sentences.chinese: 以往，公司就能一手包辦定下工作所需軟硬件的功能。

sentences.english: Our marriage was arranged by my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我們的婚姻是我父母包辦的。

sentences.english: Arranged marriages happen overnight with the couple not knowing each other.
sentences.chinese: 印度包辦婚姻現象嚴重，夫妻間甚至還未認識就結婚。

sentences.english: Even modern arranged marriages can have a large age difference within the couple。
sentences.chinese: 現代的包辦婚姻中也有很多年齡差距很大的夫婦。

sentences.english: This is where the crucial difference with arranged marriages in China lies.
sentences.chinese: 這就使其與中國的包辦婚姻的根本區別。

sentences.english: The forced marriages in china's feudal society have done lots of harm to many young people.
sentences.chinese: 中國封建社會的包辦買賣婚姻害了許多年青人。

sentences.english: Now, 108 years later, the arranged marriage still rankles.
sentences.chinese: 年了，那段包辦婚姻仍然讓哈瓦感到不滿。

sentences.english: In old China, over 95 percent of marriages were arranged and on a monetary basis.
sentences.chinese: 舊中國，95%以上的婚姻是包辦買賣婚姻。

sentences.english: child brides sometimes set themselves on fire to escape arranged marriages.
sentences.chinese: 那些童養媳有時會通過自焚來逃避包辦婚姻。

sentences.english: Then the little red hen had to do everything herself.
sentences.chinese: 然後小紅母雞就自己一手包辦所有事。

sentences.english: I errorr who takes my stake by mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我追上那個誤拿我賭注的包辦人。

sentences.english: Wedding preparation formed by the fusion of flat, can counteract managed manually Yang flower of course back to participate.
sentences.chinese: 婚禮籌備由羽平一手包辦，可中和楊朵當然回來參與。

definition: to monopolize/to take on responsibility over everything/to undertake the whole task
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
one's affiliation (i.e. the organization one is affiliated with)/subordinate (i.e. those subordinate to oneself)/belonging to/affiliated/under one's command
Tse Ting-Fung or Nicholas Tse (1980-), Cantopop star
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
